topic.title: Editing the Mail Catchall
topic.p: The catchall email address receives all email that is not specifically routed to an existing mailbox (including mail with the correct domain, but with an incorrectly spelled email name).
Important: Consider carefully how you use this feature; the catchall address might receive a lot of spam.

ol.title: To edit an account's mail catchall:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li: In the Actions column, click properties for the domain you want to edit. The Properties window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain Setup, select Edit. The Edit Domain Setup window appears.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want. If you want catchall mail delivered to a specific address, select Deliver mail to and type that address in the Deliver mail to field.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Click Save. A message appears informing you that your domain has been changed.
